title: create-sibling doesn't run with local path
body:
For `create-sibling` the [docs say](http://docs.datalad.org/en/latest/generated/man/datalad-create-sibling.html) that siblings can be created locally by setting `SSHURL` to a local path (tested on 0.12.6). 

I also noticed that the command line-help (`datalad create-sibling --help`) does *not* mention the local-path option, unlike the docs. 

Still, I expected the following to create a local sibling under `/tmp`
```
datalad create demo_siblings
datalad create-sibling -d demo_siblings -s "tmpsibling" /tmp/tmpsibling
```
Instead, if fails with 
```
[ERROR  ] Unsupported SSH URL: '/tmp/tmpsibling', use ssh://host/path or host:path syntax [create_sibling.py:__call__:499] (ValueError) 
```

I tried setting `--target-url`, `--target-path`, and `--target-pushurl` to the local path, but it gave similar errors.

However, the following works:
```
datalad clone demo_siblings /tmp/tmpsiblings
datalad siblings add -d demo_siblings --url /tmp/tmpsiblings
datalad siblings -d demo_siblings
# gives: 
# .: here(+) [git]
#  .: tmpsibling(+) [/tmp/tmpsibling (git)]
```

Am I misunderstanding the syntax of `datalad create-siblings` or has it lost the `local/path` part and the docs still reflect the old capabilities?

if the latter, any particular reason it was dropped?
